question: Which of the following is correct regarding Pleomorphic Adenoma?

choices.a: More in the deep part of parotid gland than submandibular gland
choices.c: Enucleation of the tumor carries high risk of recurrence.
choices.d: Does not carry any risk of malignant transformation

question: Which of the following is not correct regarding anal fissure?

choices.b: Posterior in the midline is the most common
choices.c: Can be detected by PR examination
choices.d: Lateral Internal Sphincterotomy is the gold standard of surgical treatment

question: Which of the following is characteristic for simple acute appendicitis?

choices.a: Board like rigidity on abdominal examination
choices.c: Periumbilical pain then pain localizes to the right lower quadrant
choices.d: Patients typically look ill and toxic.

question: Which is the most appropriate investigation for patient with suspected acute colonic diverticulitis?

choices.b: Computed tomography abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast
choices.c: Computed tomography abdomen and pelvis with IV and rectal contrast

question: Regarding Sclerosing cholangitis, which of the following is correct?

choices.a: Bile ducts appear narrow and beaded at imaging
choices.d: may be associated with inflammatory bowel disease (Crhon’s disease)

A 20-year-old Female presented to outpatient clinic with abdominal pain, bloody diarrhea not associated with mucous, Pus or tenesmus. She reported history of eating hamburger outdoors 3 days ago. On examination; she was generally good, temperature 37.1C. There was no history of medications. What is the causative organism?

A 9-year-old child, presented to the outpatient clinic with 2-day history of abdominal pain, tenesmus, foul smelling loose stool, 6 motions per day that was associated with mucous and few blood with no pus. On examination; temperature was 37.5°C. What is the next step in diagnosis of this child?

A 37-year-old female received treatment for typhoid fever based on positive Widal agglutination test and after initial favorable response; her condition deteriorated suddenly on the fourth day of treatment; she became pale with dyspnea, epistaxis & ecchymosis. Abdomen is tender but lax. Hemoglobin (7.0 gm/dl), reticulocyte 0.1%, WBC (1.5×10³/μmm), and platelets (20000/μmm). What is the most probable complication occurred in this case?

Which of the following statements is correct regarding hepatitis B infection?

choices.a: Acute hepatitis B is typically asymptomatic
choices.b: Hepatitis B e antigen (HBeAg) positivity indicates a low risk of transmission
choices.c: Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) is the earliest serologic marker to appear in infection
choices.d: Hepatitis B vaccine provides lifelong immunity

question: A patient with chronic hepatitis B infection has persistent high HBV DNA levels, HBeAg positivity, and elevated liver enzymes. What is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding hepatitis C infection?

choices.a: Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection is primarily transmitted through sexual contact
choices.b: HCV RNA testing is used to confirm acute HCV infection
choices.c: HCV infection is associated with a high risk of developing hepatocellular carcinoma
choices.d: HCV can be prevented by vaccination
